Evo kome najviše verujete

02 Nov 2019

Stigao je izveštaj sa uplatno-isplatnih mesta kladionice MOZZART. Ovo je pet najigranijih parova dana:

text:
Increase in Health BPJS Contributions Called Cheaper than Credit
02 Nov 2019 by Trio Hamdani


BPJS Director of Health Fachmi Idris / Photo: documentation 20 seconds

Jakarta - President Joko Widodo (Jokowi) officially raises BPJS Health contributions for Non Wage Recipients (PBPU) and Non-Workers at double the current rate, effective from January 1, 2020. That is stated in Presidential Regulation (Perpres) Number 75 Year 2019 concerning Amendment to Perpres Number 82 Year 2018 concerning Health Insurance signed by Jokowi on October 24, 2019. However, the increase in BPJS Health fees is believed to be still affordable for affected communities. Managing Director of BPJS Health Fachmi Idris believes that rising fees are still cheaper than the price of pulses. Is it true? Further information can be read on the next page: (toy / hns)
